title: Interfunktionen 1970, 4
description: Cologne-based F. W. Heubach founded the art and theory magazine interfunktionen in 1968. He used this publication as a platform for artists who held no affinity for Pop Art, kinetic art, environmental art and minimalism, which had dominated that year’s documenta 4 exhibition.1 Published at irregular intervals over the next seven years, the twelve issues of the magazine served as vessels for distributing information and as artworks in their own right. With a changing roster of authors and editors, interfunktionen became an influential voice in the West German art world.2 Fifty to sixty copies of each issue’s print run were special editions, containing contributions by invited artists.
remarks: Availability: Physical version at LUKAS: LKMAG; C-COLL 7.038 HEUB (1 copy, 1 available)

title: Store days documents from The store, 1961, and Ray Gun Theater, 1962, selected by Claes Oldenburg and Emmett Williams. Photos. by Robert R. McElroy.
description: This book chronicles Oldenburg's exhibitions and events at The Store, his East Village shop, in the early 1960s. Vintage publication from Dick Higgins' Something Else Press.
remarks: Availability: Physical version at LUKAS: LKMAG; C-COLL 7.071 OLDE (1 copy, 1 available)
subjects: Ray Gun Manufacturing Company; Claes Oldenburg; Art

title: Joseph Beuys und die Medizin
description: Contains works from the Murken Collection related to medicine, an interview with Beuys, and more. Text in German and English.
remarks: Availability: Physical version at LUKAS: LKMAG; C-COLL 7.071 BEUY (1 copy, 1 available)

title: Gordon Matta-Clark One for all - all for one. Eine Ausstellung zur Unterstützung des 'Fonds Gordon Matta-Clark - Zentrum für zeitgenössische Kunst Antwerpen'.
description: Rare catalogue of the exhibition at the Städtische Kunsthalle Düsseldorf, May 5th to June 4th, 1979. Illustrated pages are perforated for removal.
event: Exhibition for the 'Fonds Gordon Matta-Clark - Zentrum für zeitgenössische Kunst Antwerpen'
remarks: Availability: Physical version at LUKAS: LKMAG; C-COLL 7.071 MATT (1 copy, 1 available)
subjects: Gordon Matta-Clark; Contemporary Art; Exhibitions; Art Support Funds

title: Tableau bon levain à vous de cuire la pâte l'a̕rt brut de Jean Dubuffet
description: Cologne-based F. W. Heubach founded the art and theory magazine interfunktionen in 1968. He used this publication as a platform for artists who held no affinity for Pop Art, kinetic art, environmental art and minimalism, which had dominated that year’s documenta 4 exhibition.1 Published at irregular intervals over the next seven years, the twelve issues of the magazine served as vessels for distributing information and as artworks in their own right. With a changing roster of authors and editors, interfunktionen became an influential voice in the West German art world.2 Fifty to sixty copies of each issue’s print run were special editions, containing contributions by invited artists.
remarks: Availability: Physical version at LUKAS: LKMAG; C-COLL 75.071 DUBU  (1 copy, 1 available)
subjects: Jean Dubuffet; French painters; Art Brut

title: Christo 5600 cubicmeter package
description: For Documenta IV in 1968, Christo and Jeanne-Claude created the largest inflatable structure ever constructed without a skeleton in Kassel. After three unsuccessful attempts, it was erected on August 3, 1968, with the help of five cranes, two of which were 70 meters high and each weighed 200 tons.
remarks: Availability: Physical version at LUKAS: LKMAG; C-COLL 7.071 CHRI  (1 copy, 1 available)

title: The telephone book (with pearls)
description: Artist's book by John Baldessari. With appropriated images of people talking on telephones, Baldessari works the tension between the handset cords and people talking on phones [obscured by his charismatic cropping and circles]. The tension runs from one crop to another, defining space and societal structures. Like pearls. Edited by Kaatje Cusse.
remarks: Availability: Physical version at LUKAS: LKMAG; C-COLL 7.071 BALD  (1 copy, 1 available)

title: The Fourth Sex Adolescent Extremes
description: This book is constructed with images of fashion, art, music, cinema and the news, accompanied by an anthology of writings that mixes poetry, literature, journalism and research, highlighting the increasing importance of the teenage tribe in a society such as ours, where the inadequacy of sexual and demographic identities is reflected in a violent, contradictory way in the social changes in progress.
remarks: Availability: Physical version at LUKAS: LKMAG; C-COLL 77.041 BONA  (1 copy, 1 available)

title: Assemblage, environments & happenings
description: Lavishly illustrated art history volume with hundreds of photography reproductions illustrating artworks and artists creations from the post WWII period. The book is edited by the American Allan Kaprow, and includes groundbreaking in situ artworks and performance art by famous artist like Jasper Johns, Joseph Beuys, Nam June Paik, Carolee Schneemann, Barry Le Va, Yvonne Rainer, the Fluxus group and many others...
remarks: Availability: Physical version at LUKAS: LKMAG; C-COLL 7.071 KAPR  (1 copy, 1 available)
subjects: Assemblage; Environments; Happenings; United States; 20th Century Art

title: Neue Galerie der Stadt Aachen: Der Bestand '72. Kunst um 1970. Art around 1970.
description: The Neue Galerie in the city of Aachen was opened in February of 1970. A late 18th century spa, social center...casino...this house was crippled during the second world war...then restored with loving care...it reopened its doors offering a panorama of the newest in art. This hardback catalog sports a unique holographic cover, bolted at the corners. Text in German and English.
remarks: Availability: Physical version at LUKAS: LKMAG; C-COLL 7.074 BECK  (1 copy, 1 available); Availability: Physical version at LUKAS: LKBIB; 7.074 BECK  (1 copy, 1 available)
subjects: Pop art; Germany; Aachen; Ludwig, Peter; Art collections; Art around 1970

title: Roy Lichtenstein drawings and prints
description: Encompasses all the artist's early works, including authoritative notes and commentary.
remarks: Availability: Physical version at LUKAS: LKMAG; C-COLL 741.071 LICH  (1 copy, 1 available)
subjects: Roy Lichtenstein; Pop Art; Drawings; Prints

title: Sonsbeek '72
description: he tripartite catalogue Sonskeek [that is, Sonsbeek] '72 arose from the notes and photos we made of a project that we executed during the period November '71-June '72. The difinite [that is, definite] form of the three booklets as they now appear, is the result of collecting and combining the 360 cards; on one side a photo, on the other side a description
remarks: Availability: Physical version at LUKAS: LKMAG; C-COLL 7.071 BONG (3 copies, 3 available)
subjects: Conceptual art; Netherlands; Sonsbeek Exhibition; Pictorial works
